name: Aarakocra
extraspeed: fly equal to your walking speed
ability: Choose one of: (a) Any +2; any other +1 (b) Any +1; any other +1; any other +1

traits.name: Age
text: Aarakocra reach maturity by age 3. Compared to humans, aarakocra live very short lives, rearely longer than 30 years.

traits.name: Alignment
text: Most aarakocra are good and rarely choose sides when it comes to law and chaos. Tribal leaders and warriors might be lawful, while explorers and adventurers might tend toward chaotic.

traits.name: Size
text: Aarakocra are about 5 feet tall. They have thin, lightweight bodies that weigh between 80 and 100 pounds.

traits.name: Flight
text: Because of your wings, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed. To use this flying speed, your hands must be free and you can't be wearing medium or heavy armor.

traits.name: Talons
text: You have talons that you can use to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with them, the strike deals 1d6 + STR slashing damage.

traits.name: Wind Caller
text: Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spells gust of wind} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast the spell with this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast the spell using any spell slots you have of 2nd level or higher.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for when you cast gust of wind with this trait (choose when you select this race).

traits.name: Languages
text: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language of your choice.

name: Aasimar
ability: Choose one of: (a) Any +2; any other +1 (b) Any +1; any other +1; any other +1

traits.name: Age
text: Aasimar mature at the same rate as humans, but they can live up to 160 years.

traits.name: Alignment
text: Aasimar are imbued with positive energy and tend towards Lawful and Good, but some have Fallen from their path, or forsaken a positive/negative duality altogether.

traits.name: Size
text: Aasimar have the same range of height and weight as humans.

traits.name: Darkvision
text: Blessed with a radiant soul, your vision can easily cut through darkness. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.name: Celestial Resistance
text: You have resistance to necrotic damage and radiant damage.

traits.name: Healing Hands
text: As an action, you can touch a creature and roll a number of d4s equal to your proficiency bonus. The creature regains a number of hit points equal to the total rolled. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Light Bearer
text: You know the light cantrip. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for it.

traits.name: Languages
text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Celestial (Celestial could be replaced with one other language appropriate for your character).

traits.name: Celestial Revelation
text: When you reach 3rd level, choose one of the revelation options below. Thereafter, you can use a bonus action to unleash the celestial energy within yourself. Your transformation lasts for 1 minute or until you end it as a bonus action. Once you transform using your revelation below, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.

items.name: Necrotic Shroud
entries: Your eyes briefly become pools of darkness, and ghostly wings sprout from your back. Creatures within 10 feet of you that can see you must succeed on a Charisma save (DC 8 + prof + CHA) or become frightened of you until the end of your next turn. Until the transformation ends, once on each of your turns, you can deal necrotic damage equal to your proficiency bonus to one target when you deal damage to it.

items.name: Radiant Consumption
entries: Searing light temporarily radiates from your eyes and mouth. For the duration, you shed bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet, and at the end of each of your turns, each creature within 10 feet of you takes radiant damage equal to your proficiency bonus.  Until the transformation ends, once on each of your turns, you can deal radiant damage equal to your proficiency bonus to one target when you deal damage to it.

items.name: Radiant Soul
entries: Two luminous, spectral wings sprout from your back temporarily. Until the transformation ends, you have a flying speed equal to your walking speed, and once on each of your turns, you can deal radiant damage equal to your proficiency bonus to one target when you deal damage to it.

name: Centaur
ability: Choose one of: (a) Any +2; any other +1 (b) Any +1; any other +1; any other +1

traits.name: Age
text: Centaurs mature and age at about the same rate as humans.

traits.name: Alignment
text: Centaurs are inclined toward neutrality. Those living in remote bands are more inclined to be chaotic, while those living in more populous communes tend to be lawful.

traits.name: Size
text: Centaurs stand between 6 and 7 feet tall, with their equine bodies reaching about 4 feet at the withers.

traits.name: Fey
text: Your creature type is fey, rather than humanoid.

traits.name: Charge
text: If you move at least 30 feet straight toward a target and then hit it with a melee weapon attack on the same turn, you can immediately follow that attack with a bonus action, making one attack against the target with your hooves.

traits.name: Hooves
text: You have hooves that you can use to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with them, the strike deals 1d6 + STR bludgeoning damage, instead of the bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

traits.name: Equine Build
text: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push or drag.

In addition, any climb that requires hands and feet is especially difficult for you because of your equine legs. When you make such a climb, each foot of movement costs you 4 extra feet, instead of the normal 1 extra foot.

traits.name: Natural Affinity
text: Your fey connection to nature gives you an intuitive connection to the natural world and the animals within it. You therefore have proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: Animal Handling, Medicine, Nature, or Survival.

traits.name: Languages
text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Sylvan (Sylvan could be replaced with one other language appropriate for your character).

name: Changeling
ability: Choose one of: (a) Any +2; any other +1 (b) Any +1; any other +1; any other +1

traits.name: Age
text: Changelings mature slightly faster than humans but share a similar lifespanâ€”typically a century or less. While a changeling can transform to conceal their age, the effects of aging affect them similarly to humans.

traits.name: Alignment
text: Changelings tend toward pragmatic neutrality, and few changelings embrace evil.

traits.name: Size
text: Changelings in their notural state are usually slightly smaller than humans.

traits.name: Shapechanger
text: As an action, you can change your appearance and your voice. You determine the specifics of the changes, including your coloration, hair length, and sex. You can also adjust your height between Medium and Small. You can make yourself appear as a member of another ancestry, though none of your game statistics change. You can't duplicate the appearance of a creature you've never seen, and you must adopt a form that has the same basic arrangement of limbs that you have. Your clothing and equipment aren't changed by this trait.
You stay in the new form until you use an action to revert to your true form or until you die.

traits.name: Changeling Instincts
text: You gain proficiency with two of the following skills of your choice: Deception, Insight, Intimidation, and Persuasion.

traits.name: Languages
text: You can speak, read, and write Common and two other languages of your choice.

name: Dragonborn
ability: Choose one of: (a) Any +2; any other +1 (b) Any +1; any other +1; any other +1

traits.name: Age
text: Young dragonborn grow quickly. They walk hours after hatching, attain the size and development of a 10-year-old human child by the age of 3, and reach adulthood by 15. They live to be around 150.

traits.name: Alignment
text: Dragonborn tend to extremes, making a conscious choice for one side or the other in the cosmic war between good and evil (represented by Bahamut and Tiamat, respectively).

traits.name: Size
text: Dragonborn are taller and heavier than humans, standing well over 6 feet tall and averaging almost 250 pounds. Your size is Medium.

traits.name: Draconic Ancestry
text: You have draconic ancestry. Choose one type of dragon from the Draconic Ancestry table. Your breath weapon and damage resistance are determined by the dragon type, as shown in this table. Chromatic breath weapons are 15ft. cones while metallic breath weapons are 30ft x 5ft lines.

traits.name: Breath Weapon
text: When you take the Attack action on your turn, you can replace one of your attacks with an exhalation of magical energy in a 30-ft line that is 5-ft wide or a 15-ft cone. Each creature in that area must make a Dexterity save (DC = 8+prof+CON). On a failed save, the creature takes 1d10 damage of the type associated with your Ancestry. On a successful save, it takes half as much damage. This damage increases by 1d10 when you reach 5th level (2d10), 11th level (3d10), and 17th level (4d10).
You can use your Breath Weapon a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Damage Resistance
text: You have resistance to the damage type associated with your draconic ancestry.

traits.name: Gem Ancestry - Psionic Mind
text: Starting at 3rd level, you can chennel you draconic energy to send telepathic messages to any creature you can see within 30 feet of you. You don't need to share a language with the creature for it to understand these messages, but it must be able to understand at least one language to comprehend them.

traits.name: Chroatic Ancestry - Chromatic Warding
text: Starting at 3rd level, as an action, you can channel your draconic energy to protect yourself. For 1 minute, you become immune to the damage type associated with your Chromatic Ancestry. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Metallic Ancestry - Forceful Presence
text: Starting at 3rd level, you can use your understanding of diplomacy or intimidation to guide a conversation in your favor. When you make a Charisma (Intimidation or Persuasion) check, you can do so with advantage. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.

traits.name: Dragon Flight
text: Starting at 5th level, you can use a bonus action to manifest spectral wings on your body. These wings last for 1 minute. For the duration, you gain a flying speed equal to your walking speed and can hover. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Languages
text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Draconic.

name: Dwarf
ability: Choose one of: (a) Any +2; any other +1 (b) Any +1; any other +1; any other +1

traits.name: Age
text: Dwarves mature at the same rate as humans, but they're considered young until they reach the age of 50. On average, they live about 350 years.

traits.name: Alignment
text: Most dwarves are lawful, believing firmly in the benefits of a well-ordered society. They tend toward good as well, with a strong sense of fair play and a belief that everyone deserves to share in the benefits of a just order.

traits.name: Size
text: Dwarves stand between 4 and 5 feet tall and average about 150 pounds.

traits.name: Stout Build
text: You speed is not reduced by wearing heavy armor.

traits.name: Dwarven Resilience
text: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.

traits.name: Dwarven Combat Training
text: You have proficiency with the {@items battleaxe}, {@items handaxe}, {@items light hammer}, and {@items warhammer}.

traits.name: Tool Proficiency
text: You gain proficiency with the artisan's tools of your choice: {@items smith's tools}, {@items brewer's supplies}, or {@items mason's tools}.

traits.name: Stonecunning
text: Whenever you make an Intelligence (History) check related to the origin of stonework, you are considered proficient in the History skill and add double your proficiency bonus to the check, instead of your normal proficiency bonus.

traits.name: Languages
text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Dwarvish.

traits.name: Dwarven Toughness
text: Your hit point maximum increases by 1, and it increases by 1 every time you gain a level.

traits.name: Dwarven Armor Training
text: You have proficiency with light and medium armor.

name: Elf (Drow)
ability: Choose one of: (a) Any +2; any other +1 (b) Any +1; any other +1; any other +1

traits.name: Age
text: Although elves reach physical maturity at about the same age as humans, the elven understanding of adulthood goes beyond physical growth to encompass worldly experience. An elf typically claims adulthood and an adult name around the age of 100 and are not known to die of old age.

traits.name: Alignment
text: Drow are unlike other elves in that the live their whole lives in mysterious and sprawling cities build in the Veins of the World. Even more so than their above-ground cousins they love freedom and self-expression, and often extend teh the point of vanity, mania, and embracing the darker side of chaos. Their society values and protects itself above all others, and so most who aren't outcast tend towards neutrality or outright evil.

traits.name: Size
text: Elves range from under 5 to over 6 feet tall and have slender builds.

traits.name: Superior Darkvision
text: Accustomed to the depths of the Veins, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 120 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.name: Keen Senses
text: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
text: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

traits.name: Trance
text: Elves don't need to sleep. Instead, they meditate deeply, remaining semiconscious, for 4 hours a day. (The Common word for such meditation is "trance.") While meditating, you can dream after a fashion; such dreams are actually mental exercises that have become reflexive through years of practice. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.

traits.name: Languages
text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Elvish.

traits.name: Sunlight Sensitivity
text: You have disadvantage on attack rolls and on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on sight when you, the target of your attack, or whatever you are trying to perceive is in direct sunlight

traits.name: Drow Magic
text: You know the {@spells dancing lights} cantrip. When you reach 3rd level, you can cast the {@spells faerie fire} spell once per day; you must finish a long rest in order to cast the spell again using this trait. When you reach 5th level, you can also cast the {@spells darkness} spell once per day; you must finish a long rest in order to cast the spell again using this trait. Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells.

traits.name: Drow Weapon Training
text: You have proficiency with rapiers, shortswords, and hand crossbows.

name: Elf (High)
ability: Choose one of: (a) Any +2; any other +1 (b) Any +1; any other +1; any other +1

traits.name: Age
text: Although elves reach physical maturity at about the same age as humans, the elven understanding of adulthood goes beyond physical growth to encompass worldly experience. An elf typically claims adulthood and an adult name around the age of 100 and are not known to die of old age.

traits.name: Alignment
text: Elves love freedom, variety, and self-expression, so they lean strongly toward the gentler aspects of chaos. They value and protect others' freedom as well as their own, and they are more often good than not.

traits.name: Size
text: Elves range from under 5 to over 6 feet tall and have slender builds. Your size is Medium.

traits.name: Keen Senses
text: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
text: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

traits.name: Trance
text: Elves don't need to sleep. Instead, they meditate deeply, remaining semiconscious, for 4 hours a day. (The Common word for such meditation is "trance.") While meditating, you can dream after a fashion; such dreams are actually mental exercises that have become reflexive through years of practice. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.

traits.name: Languages
text: You can speak, read, and write Common, Elvish, and one extra language of your choice.

traits.name: Elf Weapon Training
text: You have proficiency with the longsword, shortsword, shortbow, and longbow.

traits.name: Cantrip
text: You know one cantrip of your choice from the {@spells ?spell-class-filter=wizard&spell-level-filter=0|wizard spell list}. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability for it.

name: Elf (Wood)
ability: Choose one of: (a) Any +2; any other +1 (b) Any +1; any other +1; any other +1

traits.name: Age
text: Although elves reach physical maturity at about the same age as humans, the elven understanding of adulthood goes beyond physical growth to encompass worldly experience. An elf typically claims adulthood and an adult name around the age of 100 and are not known to die of old age.

After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.

traits.name: Languages
text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Elvish.

traits.name: Elf Weapon Training
text: You have proficiency with the longsword, shortsword, shortbow, and longbow.

traits.name: Fleet of Foot
text: Your base walking speed increases to 35 feet.

traits.name: Mask of the Wild
text: You can attempt to hide even when you are only lightly obscured by foliage, heavy rain, falling snow, mist, and other natural phenomena.

name: Elf (Eladrin)
ability: Choose one of: (a) Any +2; any other +1 (b) Any +1; any other +1; any other +1

traits.name: Age
text: Although elves reach physical maturity at about the same age as humans, the elven understanding of adulthood goes beyond physical growth to encompass worldly experience. An elf typically claims adulthood and an adult name around the age of 100 and are not known to die of old age.

traits.name: Size
text: Elves range from under 5 to over 6 feet tall and have slender builds. Your size is Medium.

traits.name: Keen Senses
text: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
text: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

While meditating, you can dream after a fashion; such dreams are actually mental exercises that have become reflexive through years of practice. After resting in this way, you gain the same benefit that a human does from 8 hours of sleep.

traits.name: Languages
text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Elvish.

traits.name: Elf Weapon Training
text: You have proficiency with the longsword, shortsword, shortbow, and longbow.

traits.name: Seasonal
text: Eladrin are elves native to the Feywild, a realm of beauty, unpredictable emotion, and boundless magic. An eladrin is associated with one of the four seasons of the Feywild and has coloration reminiscent of that season, which can also affect the eladrin's mood.

Some eladrin remain associated with a particular season for their entire lives, whereas other eladrin transform, adopting characteristics of a new season. When finishing a long rest, any eladrin can change their season.

items.name: Spring
entries: The season of cheerfulness and celebration, marked by merriment as winter's sorrow passes.

items.name: Summer
entries: The season of boldness and aggression, a time of unfettered energy.

items.name: Fall
entries: The season of peace and goodwill, when summer's harvest is shared with all.

items.name: Winter
entries: The season of contemplation and dolor, when the vibrant energy of the world slumbers.

traits.name: Fey Step
text: As a bonus action, you can magically teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Once you use this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a short or long rest.
When you reach 3rd level, your Fey Step gains an additional effect based on your season; if the effect requires a saving throw, the DC equals 8 + prof + CHA:

items.name: Spring
entries: You can teleport one willing creature you touch instead of yourself.

items.name: Summer
entries: Immediately after you use your Fey Step, each creature of your choice within 5 feet of you takes fire damage equal to CHA

items.name: Fall
entries: Immediately after you use your Fey Step, up to two creatures of your choice within 10 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom save or be charmed for 1 minute, or until damage is dealt to it.

items.name: Winter
entries: Immediately before you use your Fey Step, one creature of your choice within 5 feet of you must succeed on a Wisdom save or be frightened until the end of your next turn.

name: Firbolg
ability: Choose one of: (a) Any +2; any other +1 (b) Any +1; any other +1; any other +1

traits.name: Age
text: As humanoids related to the fey, firbolg have long lifespans. A firbolg reaches adulthood around 50, and the oldest of them can live for 500 years.

traits.name: Alignment
text: As people who follow the rhythm of nature and see themselves as its caretakers, firbolg are typically neutral good. Evil firbolg are rare and are usually the sworn enemies of the rest of their kind.

traits.name: Size
text: Firbolg are between 7 and 8 feet tall and weigh between 240 and 300 pounds.

traits.name: Firbolg Magic
text: You can cast {@spells detect magic} and {@spells disguise self} with this trait. When you use this version of disguise self, you can seem up to 3 feet shorter or taller. Once you cast either of these spells with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast these spells using any spell slots you have.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this ancestry).

traits.name: Hidden Step
text: As a bonus action, you can magically turn invisible until the start of your next turn or until you attack, make a damage roll, or force someone to make a saving throw. You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Powerful Build
text: You count as one size larger when determining your carrying capacity and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

traits.name: Speech of Beast and Leaf
text: You have the ability to communicate in a limited manner with beasts and plants. They can understand the meaning of your words, though you have no special ability to understand them in return. You have advantage on all Charisma checks you make to influence them.

traits.name: Languages
text: You can speak, read, and write Common, Elvish, and Giant. (Elvish and/or Giant could be replaced with other languages appropriate for your character)

name: Genasi (Air)
ability: Choose one of: (a) Any +2; any other +1 (b) Any +1; any other +1; any other +1

traits.name: Age
text: Genasi mature at about the same rate as humans and reach adulthood in their late teens. They live somewhat longer than humans do, up to 120 years.

traits.name: Alignment
text: Independent and self-reliant, genasi tend toward a neutral alignment.

traits.name: Size
text: Genasi are as varied as their mortal parents but are generally built like humans, standing anywhere from 5 feet to over 6 feet tall.

traits.name: Unending Breath
text: You can hold your breath indefinitely while you're not incapacitated.

traits.name: Lightning Resistance
text: You have resistance to lightning damage.

traits.name: Mingle with the Wind
text: You know the {@spells shocking grasp} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spells feather fall} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Starting 5th level, you can also cast the {@spells levitate} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast feather fall or levitate with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this ancestry).

traits.name: Languages
text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Primordial.

name: Genasi (Earth)
ability: Choose one of: (a) Any +2; any other +1 (b) Any +1; any other +1; any other +1

traits.name: Age
text: Genasi mature at about the same rate as humans and reach adulthood in their late teens. They live somewhat longer than humans do, up to 120 years.

traits.name: Alignment
text: Independent and self-reliant, genasi tend toward a neutral alignment.

traits.name: Size
text: Genasi are as varied as their mortal parents but are generally built like humans, standing anywhere from 5 feet to over 6 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

traits.name: Earth Walk
text: You can move across difficult terrain without expending extra movement if you are using your walking speed on the ground or a floor.

traits.name: Merge with Stone
text: You know the {@spells blade ward} cantrip. You can cast it as normal, and you can also cast it as a bonus action a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, regaining all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

Starting at 5th level, you can cast the {@spells pass without trace} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast that spell with this trait, you can't do so again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast it using any spell slots you have of 2nd level or higher.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this ancestry).

traits.name: Languages
text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Primordial.

traits.name: Fire Resistance
text: You have resistance to fire damage.

traits.name: Reach to the Blaze
text: You know the {@spells produce flame} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spells burning hands} spell with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the {@spells flame blade} spell with this trait, without a material component. Once you cast burning hands or flame blade with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).

traits.name: Languages
text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Primordial.

traits.name: Amphibious
text: You can breathe air and water and you have a swimming speed equal to your walking speed.

traits.name: Acid Resistance
text: You have resistance to acid damage.

traits.name: Call to the Wave
text: You know the {@spells acid splash} cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the {@spells create or destroy water} spell with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the {@spells water walk} spell with this trait, without requiring a material component. Once you cast create or destroy water or water walk with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).

traits.name: Languages
text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Primordial.

name: Gnome (Forest)
ability: Choose one of: (a) Any +2; any other +1 (b) Any +1; any other +1; any other +1

traits.name: Age
text: Gnomes mature at the same rate humans do, and most are expected to settle down into an adult life by around age 40. They can live 350 to almost 500 years.

traits.name: Alignment
text: Gnomes are most often good. Those who tend toward law are sages, engineers, researchers, scholars, investigators, or inventors. Those who tend toward chaos are minstrels, tricksters, wanderers, or fanciful jewelers. Gnomes are good-hearted, and even the tricksters among them are more playful than vicious.

traits.name: Size
text: Gnomes are between 3 and 4 feet tall and average about 40 pounds.

traits.name: Gnome Cunning
text: You have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

traits.name: Languages
text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Gnomish.

traits.name: Natural Illusionist
text: You know the {@spells minor illusion} cantrip. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this spell (choose when you select this race).

traits.name: Speak with Small Beasts
text: Through sounds and gestures, you can communicate simple ideas with Small or smaller beasts. Forest gnomes love animals and often keep squirrels, badgers, rabbits, moles, woodpeckers, and other creatures as beloved pets.

name: Gnome (Rock)
ability: Choose one of: (a) Any +2; any other +1 (b) Any +1; any other +1; any other +1

traits.name: Age
text: Gnomes mature at the same rate humans do, and most are expected to settle down into an adult life by around age 40. They can live 350 to almost 500 years.

traits.name: Alignment
text: Gnomes are most often good. Those who tend toward law are sages, engineers, researchers, scholars, investigators, or inventors. Those who tend toward chaos are minstrels, tricksters, wanderers, or fanciful jewelers. Gnomes are good-hearted, and even the tricksters among them are more playful than vicious.

traits.name: Size
text: Gnomes are between 3 and 4 feet tall and average about 40 pounds. Your size is Small.

traits.name: Gnome Cunning
text: You have advantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

traits.name: Languages
text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Gnomish.

traits.name: Artificer's Lore
text: Whenever you make an Intelligence (History) check related to magic items, alchemical objects, or technological devices, you can add twice your proficiency bonus, instead of any proficiency bonus you normally apply.

traits.name: Tinker
text: You have proficiency with artisan's tools (tinker's tools). Using those tools, you can spend 1 hour and 10 gp worth of materials to construct a Tiny clockwork device (AC 5, 1 hp). The device ceases to function after 24 hours (unless you spend 1 hour repairing it to keep the device functioning), or when you use your action to dismantle it; at that time, you can reclaim the materials used to create it. You can have up to three such devices active at a time.
When you create a device, choose one of the following options:

Clockwork Toy. This toy is a clockwork animal, monster, or person, such as a frog, mouse, bird, dragon, or soldier. When placed on the ground, the toy moves 5 feet across the ground on each of your turns in a random direction. It makes noises as appropriate to the creature it represents.
Fire Starter. The device produces a miniature flame, which you can use to light a candle, torch, or campfire. Using the device requires your action.
Music Box. When opened, this music box plays a single song at a moderate volume. The box stops playing when it reaches the song's end or when it is closed.

name: Goliath
ability: Choose one of: (a) Any +2; any other +1 (b) Any +1; any other +1; any other +1

traits.name: Age
text: Goliaths have lifespans comparable to humans. They enter adulthood in their late teens and usually live less than a century.

traits.name: Alignment
text: Goliath society, with its clear roles and tasks, has a strong lawful bent. The goliath sense of fairness, balanced with an emphasis on self sufficiency and personal accountability, pushes them toward neutrality.

traits.name: Size
text: Goliaths are between 7 and 8 feet tall and weigh between 280 and 340 pounds.

traits.name: Little Giant
text: You have proficiency in the Athletics skill, and you count as one size larger when determining your carrying weight and the weight you can push, drag, or lift.

traits.name: Stone's Endurance
text: You can supernaturally draw on unyielding stone to shrug off harm. When you take damage, you can use your reaction to roll a d12. Add your Constitution modifier to the number rolled and reduce the damage by that total.
You can use this trait a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Mountain Born
text: You have resistance to cold damage. You also naturally acclimate to high altitudes, even if you've never been to one. This includes elevations above 20,000 feet.

traits.name: Languages
text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Giant. (Giant could be replaced with another language appropriate for your character)

name: Half-Elf
ability: Choose one of: (a) Any +2; any other +1 (b) Any +1; any other +1; any other +1

traits.name: Age
text: Half-elves mature at the same rate humans do and reach adulthood around the age of 20. They live much longer than humans, however, often exceeding 300 years.

traits.name: Alignment
text: Half-elves share the chaotic bent of their elven heritage. They value both personal freedom and creative expression, demonstrating neither love of leaders nor desire for followers. They chafe at rules, resent others' demands, and sometimes prove unreliable, or at least unpredictable.

traits.name: Size
text: Half-elves are about the same size as humans, ranging from 5 to 6 feet tall. Your size is Medium.

traits.name: Ability Score Increase
text: An ability score of your choice increase by 1.

traits.name: Fey Ancestry
text: You have advantage on saving throws against being charmed, and magic can't put you to sleep.

traits.name: Skill Versatility
text: You gain proficiency in two skills of your choice.

traits.name: Languages
text: You can speak, read, and write Common, Elvish, and one extra language of your choice.

name: Half-Orc
ability: Choose one of: (a) Any +2; any other +1 (b) Any +1; any other +1; any other +1

traits.name: Age
text: Half-orcs mature a little faster than humans, reaching adulthood around age 14. They age noticeably faster and rarely live longer than 75 years.

traits.name: Alignment
text: Half-orcs inherit a tendency toward chaos from their orc parents. Half-orcs raised among orcs and willing to live out their lives among them are usually evil.

traits.name: Size
text: Half-orcs are somewhat larger and bulkier than humans, and they range from 5 to well over 6 feet tall.

traits.name: Menacing
text: You gain proficiency in the Intimidation skill.

traits.name: Relentless Endurance
text: When you are reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can drop to 1 hit point instead. You can't use this feature again until you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Savage Attacks
text: When you score a critical hit with a melee weapon attack, you can roll one of the weapon's damage dice one additional time and add it to the extra damage of the critical hit.

traits.name: Languages
text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Orc. Orc is a harsh, grating language with hard consonants. It has no script of its own but is written in the Dwarvish script.

name: Halfling (Ghostwise)
ability: Choose one of: (a) Any +2; any other +1 (b) Any +1; any other +1; any other +1

traits.name: Age
text: A halfling reaches adulthood at the age of 20 and generally lives into the middle of his or her second century.

traits.name: Alignment
text: Most halflings are lawful good. As a rule, they are good-hearted and kind, hate to see others in pain, and have no tolerance for oppression. They are also very orderly and traditional, leaning heavily on the support of their community and the comfort of their old ways.

traits.name: Size
text: Halflings average about 3 feet tall and weigh about 40 pounds.

traits.name: Lucky
text: When you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

traits.name: Brave
text: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

traits.name: Halfling Nimbleness
text: You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.

traits.name: Languages
text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Halfling.

traits.name: Silent Speech
text: You can speak telepathically to any creature within 30 feet of you. The creature understands you only if the two of you share a language. You can speak telepathically in this way to one creature at a time.

name: Halfling (Lightfoot)
ability: Choose one of: (a) Any +2; any other +1 (b) Any +1; any other +1; any other +1

traits.name: Age
text: A halfling reaches adulthood at the age of 20 and generally lives into the middle of his or her second century.

traits.name: Alignment
text: Most halflings are lawful good. As a rule, they are good-hearted and kind, hate to see others in pain, and have no tolerance for oppression. They are also very orderly and traditional, leaning heavily on the support of their community and the comfort of their old ways.

traits.name: Size
text: Halflings average about 3 feet tall and weigh about 40 pounds. Your size is Small.

traits.name: Lucky
text: When you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

traits.name: Brave
text: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

traits.name: Halfling Nimbleness
text: You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.

traits.name: Languages
text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Halfling.

traits.name: Naturally Stealthy
text: You can attempt to hide even when you are obscured only by a creature that is at least one size larger than you.

name: Halfling (Stout)
ability: Choose one of: (a) Any +2; any other +1 (b) Any +1; any other +1; any other +1

traits.name: Age
text: A halfling reaches adulthood at the age of 20 and generally lives into the middle of his or her second century.

traits.name: Alignment
text: Most halflings are lawful good. As a rule, they are good-hearted and kind, hate to see others in pain, and have no tolerance for oppression. They are also very orderly and traditional, leaning heavily on the support of their community and the comfort of their old ways.

traits.name: Size
text: Halflings average about 3 feet tall and weigh about 40 pounds. Your size is Small.

traits.name: Lucky
text: When you roll a 1 on an attack roll, ability check, or saving throw, you can reroll the die and must use the new roll.

traits.name: Brave
text: You have advantage on saving throws against being frightened.

traits.name: Halfling Nimbleness
text: You can move through the space of any creature that is of a size larger than yours.

traits.name: Languages
text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Halfling.

traits.name: Stout Resilience
text: You have advantage on saving throws against poison, and you have resistance against poison damage.

name: Human
ability: Choose one of: (a) Any +2; any other +1 (b) Any +1; any other +1; any other +1

traits.name: Age
text: Humans reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

traits.name: Alignment
text: Humans tend toward no particular alignment.

traits.name: Size
text: Humans vary widely in height and build, from barely 5 feet to well over 6 feet tall. Regardless of your position in that range, your size is Medium.

traits.name: Languages
text: You can speak, read, and write Common and one extra language of your choice. Humans typically learn the languages of other peoples they deal with, including obscure dialects. They are fond of sprinkling their speech with words borrowed from other tongues: Orc curses, Elvish musical expressions, Dwarvish military phrases, and so on.

traits.name: Skills
text: You gain proficiency in one skill of your choice.

traits.name: Feat
text: You gain one feat of your choice.

name: Kenku
ability: Choose one of: (a) Any +2; any other +1 (b) Any +1; any other +1; any other +1

traits.name: Age
text: Kenku have shorter lifespans than humans. They reach maturity at about 12 years old and can live to 60.

traits.name: Alignment
text: Kenku are chaotic creatures, rarely making enduring commitments, and they care mostly for preserving their own hides. They are generally chaotic neutral in outlook.

traits.name: Size
text: Kenku are usually between 4 and 5 feet tall and weigh between 70 and 120 pounds.

traits.name: Languages
text: You can read and write Common and one other language of your choice, but you can only speak using your Mimicry trait.

traits.name: Expert Duplication
text: When you copy writing or craftwork produced by yourself or someone else, you have advantage on any ability checks you make to produce an exact duplicate.

traits.name: Kenku Recall
text: Thanks to your supernaturally good memory, you have proficiency in two skills of your choice.

Moreover, when you make an ability check using any skill in which you have proficiency, you can give yourself advantage on the check before rolling the d20. You can give yourself advantage in this way a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Mimicry
text: You can accurately mimic sounds you have heard, including voices. A creature that hears the sounds you make can tell they are imitations only with a successful Wisdom (Insight) check against a DC of 8 + prof + CHA.

name: Tiefling
ability: Choose one of: (a) Any +2; any other +1 (b) Any +1; any other +1; any other +1

traits.name: Age
text: Tieflings mature at the same rate as humans but live a few years longer.

traits.name: Alignment
text: Tieflings might not have an innate tendency toward evil, but because of their circumstances, many of them end up there. Evil or not, an independent nature inclines many tieflings toward a chaotic alignment.

traits.name: Size
text: Tieflings are about the same size and build as humans. Your size is Medium.

traits.name: Darkvision
text: Thanks to your infernal heritage, you have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.name: Hellish Resistance
text: You have resistance to fire damage.

traits.name: Languages
text: You can speak, read, and write Common and Infernal.

traits.name: Devilish Heritages
text: Tieflings can be born of a variety of devilish heritages. Choose one from below.

You learn the listed cantrip. Starting at 3rd level, you can cast the 1st level spell with this trait. Starting at 5th level, you can also cast the 2nd level spell with this trait. Once you cast the 1st or 2nd level spell with this trait, you can't cast that spell with it again until you finish a long rest. You can also cast either of those spells using any spell slots you have of the appropriate level.
Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for these spells when you cast them with this trait (choose when you select this race).

traits.name: Appearance
text: Your tiefling might not look like other tieflings. You might choose 1d4 + 1 of the following features: small horns; fangs or sharp teeth; a forked tongue; catlike eyes; six fingers on each hand; goatlike legs; cloven hoofs; a forked tail; leathery or scaly skin; red or dark blue skin; cast no shadow or reflection; exude a smell of brimstone

name: Shifter
ability: Choose one of: (a) Any +2; any other +1 (b) Any +1; any other +1; any other +1

traits.name: Age
text: Shifters are quick to mature both physically and emotionally, reaching young adulthood at age 10. They rarely live to be more than 70 years old.

traits.name: Alignment
text: Shifters tend toward neutrality, being more focused on survival than concepts of good and evil. A love of personal freedom can drive shifters toward chaotic alignments.

traits.name: Size
text: Shinters are human-sized, often growing slightly larger when shifting

traits.name: Darkvision
text: You have superior vision in dark and dim conditions. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.name: Shifting
text: As a bonus action, you can assume a more bestial appearance. This transformation lasts for 1 minute, until you die, or until you revert to your normal appearance as a bonus action. When you shift, you gain temporary hit points equal to 2 times your proficiency bonus. You can shift a number of times equal to your proficiency bonus, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.

traits.name: Shifting Feature
text: Whenever you shift, you gain an additional benefit based on one of the following options (choose when you select this race):
Beasthide. You gain 1d6 additional temporary hit points. While shifted, you have a +1 bonus to your Armor Class.

Longtooth. When you shift and as a bonus action on your turn while shifted, you can use your elongated fangs to make an unarmed strike. If you hit with your fangs, you can deal piercing damage equal to 1d6 + STR.

Swiftstride. While shifted, your walking speed increases by 10 feet. Additionally, you can move up to 10 feet as a reaction when a creature ends its turn within 5 feet of you without provoking opportunity attacks.
Wildhunt. While shifted, you have advantage on Wisdom checks, and no creature within 30 feet of you can make an attack roll with advantage against you unless you're incapacitated.

traits.name: Bestial Instincts
text: Channeling the beast within, you have proficiency in one of the following skills of your choice: Acrobatics, Athletics, Intimidation, or Survival.

traits.name: Languages
text: You can speak, read, and write Common.

name: Tabaxi
extraspeed: climb equal to your walking speed
ability: Choose one of: (a) Any +2; any other +1 (b) Any +1; any other +1; any other +1

traits.name: Age
text: Tabaxi have lifespans similar to humans. They reach adulthood in their late teens and live less than a century.

traits.name: Alignment
text: Tabaxi tend toward chaotic alignments, as they let impulse and fancy guide their decisions. They are rarely evil, with most of them driven by curiosity rather than greed or other dark impulses.

traits.name: Size
text: Tabaxi are taller on average than humans and relatively slender.

traits.name: Darkvision
text: You have a cat's keen senses, especially in the dark. You can see in dim light within 60 feet of you as if it were bright light, and in darkness as if it were dim light. You can't discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

traits.name: Cat's Claws
text: Because of your claws,  you have a climbing speed equal to your walking speed. In addition, you can use your claws to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with them, the strike deals 1d6 + STR slashing damage.

traits.name: Feline Agility
text: Your reflexes and agility allow you to move with a burst of speed. When you move on your turn in combat, you can double your speed until the end of the turn. Once you use this trait, you can't use it again until you move 0 feet on one of your turns.

traits.name: Cat's Talents
text: You have proficiency in the Perception and Stealth skills.

traits.name: Languages
text: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language of your choice.

name: Tortle
ability: Choose one of: (a) Any +2; any other +1 (b) Any +1; any other +1; any other +1

traits.name: Age
text: Young tortles crawl for a few weeks after birth before learning to walk on two legs. They reach adulthood by the age of 15 and live an average of 120 years.

traits.name: Alignment
text: Tortles tend to lead orderly, ritualistic lives. They develop customs and routines, becoming more set in their ways as they age. Most are lawful good. A few can be selfish and greedy, tending more toward evil, but it's unusual for a tortle to shuck off order in favor of chaos.

traits.name: Size
text: Tortle adults stand 5 to 6 feet tall and average 450 pounds. Their shells account for roughly one-third of their weight.

traits.name: Claws
text: You have claws that you can use to make unarmed strikes. When you hit with them, the strike deals 1d6 + STR slashing damage.

traits.name: Hold Breath
text: You can hold your breath for up to 1 hour at a time. Tortles aren't natural swimmers, but they can remain underwater for some time before needing to come up for air.

traits.name: Natural Armor
text: Your shell provides you a base AC of 17 (your Dexterity modifier doesn't affect this number). Your shell and the shape of your body means you can't wear light, medium, or heavy armor, but if you are using a shield, you can apply the shield's bonus as normal.

traits.name: Shell Defense
text: You can withdraw into your shell as an action. Until you emerge, you gain a +4 bonus to AC, and you have advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws. While in your shell, you are prone, your speed is 0 and can't increase, you have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, you can't take reactions, and the only action you can take is a bonus action to emerge from your shell.

traits.name: Nature's Intuition
text: Thanks to your mystical connection to nature, you gain proficiency with one of the following skills of your choice: Animal Handling, Medicine, Nature, Perception, Stealth, or Survival.

traits.name: Languages
text: You can speak, read, and write Aquan and Common.

name: Grung
ability: Choose one of: (a) Any +2; any other +1 (b) Any +1; any other +1; any other +1

traits.name: Age
text: Grungs mature to adulthood in a single year, but have been known to live up to 50 years.

traits.name: Alignment
text: Most grungs are lawful, having been raised in a strict caste system. They tend toward evil as well, coming from a culture where social advancement occurs rarely, and most often because another member of your army has died and there is no one else of that caste to fill the vacancy.

traits.name: Size
text: Grungs stand between 2Â½ and 3Â½ feet tall and average about 30 pounds. Your size is Small.

traits.name: Arboreal Alertness
text: You have proficiency in the Perception skill.

traits.name: Amphibious
text: You can breathe air and water.

traits.name: Poison Immunity
text: You're immune to poison damage and the poisoned condition.

traits.name: Poisonous Skin
text: Any creature that grapples you or otherwise comes into direct contact with your skin must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or become poisoned for 1 minute. A poisoned creature no longer in direct contact with you can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success.

You can also apply this poison to any piercing weapon as part of an attack with that weapon, though when you hit the poison reacts differently. The target must succeed on a DC 12 Constitution saving throw or take 2d4 poison damage.

traits.name: Standing Leap
text: Your long jump is up to 25 feet and your high jump is up to 15 feet, with or without a running start.

traits.name: Languages
text: You can speak, read, and write Grung.

traits.name: Water Dependancy
text: If you fail to immerse yourself in water for at least 1 hour during a day, you suffer one level of exhaustion at the end of that day. You can only recover from this exhaustion through magic or by immersing yourself in water for at least 1 hour.

name: Warforged
ability: Choose one of: (a) Any +2; any other +1 (b) Any +1; any other +1; any other +1

traits.name: Age
text: A typical warforged is between two and thirty years old. The maximum warforged lifespan remains a mystery; so far, warforged have shown no signs of deterioration due to age. You are immune to magical aging effects.

traits.name: Alignment
text: Most warforged take comfort in order and discipline, tending toward law and neutrality. But some have absorbed the morality, or lack thereof, of the beings with which they served.

traits.name: Size
text: Your size in Medium.

traits.name: Sentry's Rest
text: When you take a long rest, you must spend at least six hours in an inactive, motionless state, rather than sleeping. In this state, you appear inert, but it doesn't render you unconscious, and you can see and hear as normal.

traits.name: Constructed Resilience
text: You were created to have remarkable fortitude, represented by the following benefits:
You have advantage on saving throws against being poisoned, and you have resistance to poison damage.
You don't need to eat, drink, or breathe.
You are immune to disease.
You don't need to sleep, and magic can't put you to sleep.

traits.name: Integrated Protection
text: Your body has built-in defensive layers, which can be enhanced with armor:
You gain a +1 bonus to Armor Class.

You can don only armor with which you have proficiency. To don armor other than a shield, you must incorporate it into your body over the course of 1 hour, during which you remain in contact with the armor. To doff armor, you must spend 1 hour removing it. You can rest while donning or doffing armor in this way.
While you live, the armor incorporated into your body can't be removed against your will.

traits.name: Specialized Design
text: You gain one skill proficiency and one tool proficiency of your choice.

traits.name: Languages
text: You can speak, read, and write Common and one other language of your choice.
